title: (x) "Freia Chocolade Fabrik" early 20th century sans - similar to Titling Gothic {Geoff}
content:
Can anyone help med font a font a bit similar to this old signage.

Thanks.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20070806231449im_/http:/typophile.com/files/freia.jpg)

 [‹ (x) accessories. a short story. - Joanna {Matthew B}](http://web.archive.org/web/20070806231449/http:/typophile.com/node/19415 "Go to previous forum topic") ["Music Essence" vintage looking wide display serif ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20070806231449/http:/typophile.com/node/19347 "Go to next forum topic")
author: henand

comments.content:
While not an exacting match, [Benton Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20070806231449/http:/www.fontbureau.com/fonts/BentonSans)\* from [Font Bureau](http://web.archive.org/web/20070806231449/http:/www.fontbureau.com/) is similar.

\* It has three condensed weights, Condensed, Compressed and Extra Compressed.

Actually, I think the condensed [Titling Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20070806231449/http:/www.fontbureau.com/fonts/TitlingGothicFB) (again from Font Bureau) would be also good if not better, it’s gorgeous.

[Why start a 2nd thread about it?](http://web.archive.org/web/20070806231449/http:/typophile.com/node/19395)

_( Two different ’users’ posting an identical ID request, within hours? Is this a school project, or a game / contest / whatever, again? :)_

Dav
Thanks for great help on this one. You’re right formlos, a schoolproject.
